items.title: Frank's failing Spurs knocked out of FA Cup by Aston Villa
items.summary: Goals from Emiliano Buendia and Morgan Rogers knock a wasteful Tottenham Hotspur side out of the FA Cup to pile more pressure on manager Thomas Frank.

items.title: VI Live: PSV laat de teugels vieren met ruime voorsprong op zak
items.summary: Zaterdag om 20.00 uur hervat PSV de Eredivisie. De koploper krijgt om 20.00 uur bezoek van Excelsior. In deze VI Live blijf je volledig op de hoogte van die wedstrijd.

items.title: Charlton v Chelsea: FA Cup third round ‚Äì live
items.summary: ‚öΩ Updates from the 8pm GMT kick-off at The Valley ‚öΩ Latest scores | Read Football Daily | Mail Rob 5 min Badiashile gets an early yellow card for pulling down Leaburn, who was in the Chelsea academy until the age of 16. 4 min Campbell‚Äôs low cross from the left is put behind for a corner by Andrey Santos. Bree takes, Jorgensen punches a little unconvincingly but gets away with it. Continue reading...

items.title: 'Feyenoord-flop Conteh maakt transfer naar Bundesliga'
items.summary: In dit blog vind je alle speculaties en bevestigde transfers in het buitenland. Bekijk hier ons blog voor de transferperikelen in Nederland.

items.title: VI Live: NAC-aanwinst Ayew op de bank, Rosenior met Hato begonnen bij Chelsea
items.summary: Zaterdag wordt de Eredivisie weer hervat. Er staan vier wedstrijden op het programma. Daarnaast is er volop voetbal in het buitenland. In deze VI Live blijf je op de hoogte van de belangrijkste verrichtingen in binnen- en buitenland.

items.title: Sixth-tier Macclesfield stun FA Cup champs Palace
items.summary: Non-league Macclesfield pulled off one of the biggest-ever FA Cup upsets as they knocked out holders Crystal Palace in a remarkable 2-1 win at the third-round stage.

items.title: Kompany: Karl's Real Madrid comments an 'error'
items.summary: Bayern boss Vincent Kompany has labelled Lennart Karl's recent comments on Real Madrid an "error".

items.title: Parkinson revels as Wrexham pass 'next stage'
items.summary: Phil Parkinson believes knocking Nottingham Forest out of the FA Cup will help Wrexham's push to play Premier League teams on an equal footing.

items.title: Sources: Man United aim for boss clarity next week
items.summary: Manchester United are hoping to have clarity on who will lead the team for the rest of the season early next week, sources have told ESPN.

items.title: Aston Villa oust Spurs to pile pressure on Frank
items.summary: A spirited second-half rally could not prevent Tottenham Hotspur exiting the FA Cup after a 2-1 home defeat to Aston Villa to further increase the pressure on Thomas Frank.

items.title: Buend√≠a deepens gloom for Frank and Spurs with victory for Aston Villa in FA Cup
items.summary: This was Tottenham‚Äôs second defeat to Aston Villa this season and it is becoming increasingly hard to imagine Thomas Frank being in charge when the teams come together a third time in May. A performance that put an end to any realistic chance of a trophy this season, it fell well below the expectations of a furious crowd. That their opponents offer the diametric opposite of Spurs‚Äô dysfunction can only have heightened the sting. Goals from Emi Buend√≠a and Morgan Rogers put this tie to bed for Villa in the first half, Wilson Odobert‚Äôs strike after half-time bringing a closeness to the scoreline that was not reflected in the general play. A scuffle on the field at the final whistle involving Rogers, Jo√£o Palhinha and a host of Tottenham players only added further sourness to the occasion. Continue reading...

items.title: Weston-super-Mare‚Äôs builders and lecturers fall just short of FA Cup glory at Grimsby
items.summary: The magic of the FA Cup in Cleethorpes, ultimately, was limited to a good old-fashioned away following of about 571 hardy yet boisterous souls from Weston-super-Mare. The Seagull Army twice wildly celebrated second-half equalisers through Luke Coulson and their predatory striker Louis Britton before Grimsby substitute Kieran Green‚Äôs looping header settled the match and ended Weston‚Äôs stirring six-game run in the competition. Continue reading...

items.title: Pressure builds on Frank as Spurs booed off after FA Cup exit to Villa
items.summary: Tottenham were booed off as pressure continues to build on Thomas Frank following a 2-1 defeat to Aston Villa in the third round of the FA Cup.

items.title: Aston Villa knikkert Spurs uit FA Cup in duel vol Nederlanders
items.summary: Aston Villa heeft zaterdag Tottenham Hotspur uit de FA Cup geknikkerd. Spurs begon in de tweede helft nog moedig aan een inhaalslag, maar dat bleek niet genoeg en zo zitten de Engelse bekeravonturen er voor dit seizoen weer op voor de Noord-Londenaren.

items.title: PSV verliest trefzekere Pepi al voor de rust met armblessure
items.summary: Ricardo Pepi is zaterdagavond met een armblessure van het veld gegaan bij het thuisduel van PSV met Excelsior. De Amerikaanse spits raakte geblesseerd bij het maken van de 2-0 voor de Eindhovenaren.

items.title: Given apologises for Holocaust remark
items.summary: Former Premier League goalkeeper Shay Given "unreservedly" apologises for describing Wilfried Nancy's short time as Celtic manager as an "absolute Holocaust" on BBC show Final Score.

items.title: 'Humble' Semenyo steals show in FA Cup mauling
items.summary: Antoine Semenyo signed off at Bournemouth in fairytale fashion and makes start to life at Manchester City in a similarly dreamy manner during 10-1 FA Cup win over League One Exeter City.

items.title: Macclesfield realise impossible dream in rise from ashes to a day of historic glory
items.summary: Rob Smethurst‚Äôs resurrection of a troubled but proud club is timely reminder that football can still be the people‚Äôs game From extinction to the impossible dream of becoming the greatest FA Cup giantkillers of all, Macclesfield‚Äôs story reminds that community will forever be football‚Äôs greatest asset. As fans celebrated victory over the holders, Crystal Palace, many took their time to peel away from the stadium. Not too long ago, many feared they may never return to Moss Rose. Macclesfield Town FC, 1874-2020 was the etching on the gravestone of the club that died, mourned quietly by a town that had slowly lost touch with events at the shambling football ground on its southern tip, pretty much the last stop before the long drive to London begins. Continue reading...

items.title: Ramsdale the penalty hero as Newcastle edge Bournemouth in FA Cup thriller
items.summary: Aaron Ramsdale was Newcastle‚Äôs hero as they edged past Bournemouth into the FA Cup fourth round on penalties. The on-loan Southampton goalkeeper saved from Evanilson, √Ålex Jim√©nez and Bafod√© Diakit√© to seal a 7-6 shootout win after a pulsating encounter had ended 3-3 after 120 minutes. However, Eddie Howe was counting the cost, with Tuesday‚Äôs Carabao Cup semi-final first leg at home to Manchester City in mind. Marcus Tavernier had taken the tie to penalties with an equaliser in the second minute of stoppage time at the end of extra time seconds after Harvey Barnes thought he had won it for Newcastle. The hosts had led through a Barnes goal, but trailed 2-1 after Alex Scott and David Brooks scored in quick succession before Anthony Gordon‚Äôs late spot-kick. Continue reading...

items.title: Fulham battle back to knock Middlesbrough out
items.summary: Harry Wilson, Emile Smith Rowe and Kevin all scored in the second half as Fulham fought from behind to secure a 3-1 FA Cup victory against Middlesbrough.
